main event: A bright light was sighted moving in a direct line from north to south over Kenosha, Wisconsin on May 17, 1950.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by two individuals,The light was described as slightly shining and moving at altitudes between 10,000 to 15,000 feet,The object stopped on the southeast horizon before changing direction and moving in a southeast direction,The weather conditions during the sighting were slightly cloudy with a light wind,The report was made by a 13-year-old resident in Kenosha.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
